subject: p13352405
History: -year-old male status post pigtail placement, question pneumothorax.
Findings: There has been interval placement of a right pleural pigtail catheter projecting over the right lower chest and protruding no more than 25cm into the chest with associated interval decrease in size of a right pleural effusion. A right pleural effusion remains, with right basilar opacity likely representing persistent atelectasis. The cardiac silhouette is normal in size. The mediastinal contours are normal. The known prominent subcarinal node is not well appreciated.
Impression: Interval right pleural pigtail catheter placement, which projects of the lower right chest, and protrudes not more than 25 cm into the chest. There has been interval decrease in size of a right pleural effusion, persistent right basilar atelectasis is seen.
